node.category: What is the way things are?
Should there be more political interventions?
What should trigger a political intervention?

node.surface: A violation of international law should be more than enough to consider a reaction!

node.category: Why is it important to react?

node.surface: Humanity has made enough mistakes throughout history by waiting too long,
and when it has finally reacted,
the only remaining option has usually been war.

node.category: What could be a counterargument to more interventions?

node.surface: It's to be noted that in our civilized world, in a democratic country, the people can determine their own fate,

node.category: When can people not determine their own fate?

node.surface: as long as the motivation of those people isn't triggered by propaganda, corruption and military pressure.

node.category: How about propaganda and corruption in Russia?

node.surface: Since, however, in Russia besides gas and oil only propaganda and corruption rule,

node.category: Is this reason enough for an intervention?

node.surface: the EU should intervene right away.
